questions.question: What HTTP status code means 'Not Found'?
What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A way to close a browser tab
A function that retains access to its outer scope after the outer function returns

questions.question: What is the event loop in Node.js?
options: A mechanism that handles asynchronous operations by deferring callbacks to the call stack when it is empty

questions.question: What is JSX?
options: A syntax extension that allows HTML-like code inside JavaScript

questions.question: What is database normalisation?
options: Organising data to reduce redundancy and improve integrity

questions.question: What is a microservice?
options: An independently deployable service that handles a single business capability

questions.question: What is the difference between == and === in JavaScript?
options: == compares value only; === compares value and type

questions.question: What is SQL injection?
options: Adding SQL databases to an application
A security attack that inserts malicious SQL into queries
A way to speed up SQL queries

questions.question: What is React's virtual DOM?
options: A DOM stored in a database
A lightweight in-memory representation of the real DOM used to optimise updates

questions.question: What is the CAP theorem?
options: A theorem stating a distributed system can only guarantee two of Consistency, Availability, and Partition tolerance

questions.question: What is the SOLID principle 'Single Responsibility'?
options: A class should have only one reason to change
Only senior developers write SOLID code
Single responsibility means one file per project

questions.question: What is code splitting in web development?
options: Dividing a codebase between multiple teams
Breaking a JavaScript bundle into smaller chunks loaded on demand

questions.question: What is OAuth 2.0?
options: An authorisation framework for delegated access to resources

questions.question: What is a CDN?
options: Content Delivery Network — a distributed system of servers that serves content from locations closest to users
